title.narrative: Green Economy in a Changing Arab World
Économie verte dans un monde arabe qui change

description.narrative:
This project will support the regional conference, Green Economy in a Changing Arab World. The Arab Forum for Environment and Development is organizing the event, which will be held in October 2011 in Beirut, Lebanon.
The green debate The conference will add value to policy debates in the region on the transition to a green economy. It is a complex, multi-faceted, and multisectoral issue.
The UN Economic and Social Commission for West Asia (ESCWA) hosted a conference on economic policies that support the transition to a green economy. Discussions identified the need for restructuring to prepare for Arab economies to transition in different sectors. Participants explored the challenges and possible entry points for governments, private sector, and different stakeholders.
About the green economy conference The conference will feature experts on the transition to a green economy in each of the eight sectors covered in the regional report: -energy -water -agriculture -industry -cities-buildings -transport -tourism -waste management
The conference report will highlight the economic, social, and environmental implications of potential green policies. It will explore new green investment opportunities, business models, and innovative solutions. The report will aim to support Arab countries in creating competitive and diversified economies, while addressing major environmental and social challenges such as poverty, food and water security, climate change, and energy.
It will include more than 60 case studies demonstrating novel green initiatives in each of the sectors.
